@gunan Given the problem is finding the header file, not the .so libraries, I doubt setting LD_LIBRARY_PATH would help.

Note also that it's not just the path that is different, the header is called "cudnn_v5.h" not "cudnn.h".

This is a configuration we should support without needing workarounds (Ubuntu with NVidia's CUDA/CUDNN packages).
